Homework (due 0429)

Complete these for Monday, April 29. Show work that justifies your answers for full credit.

  1. Give parametric equations for the following conic sections (right branches for any hyperbolas):

    1. \(x^2-y^2=15\)

      \((x,y)=(\sqrt{15}\cosh t,\sqrt{15}\sinh t)\)

    2. \((x-3)^2+(y+2)^2=100\)

      \((x,y)=(3+10\cos t,-2+10\sin t), 0\leq t\lt 2\pi\)

    3. \(\frac{x^2}{25}+\frac{y^2}{16}=1\)

      \((x,y)=(5\cos t,4\sin t), 0\leq t\lt 2\pi\)

    4. \(\frac{(x+1)^2}{36}+\frac{(y+1)^2}{64}=1\)

      \((x,y)=(-1+6\cos t,-1+8\sin t), 0\leq t\lt 2\pi\)

    5. \(\frac{x^2}{4}-\frac{y^2}{9}=1\)

      \((x,y)=(2\cosh t, 3\sinh t)\)

    6. \((x+2)^2-\frac{y^2}{4}=1\)

      \((x,y)=(-2+\cosh t,2\sinh t)\)

    7. \(x^2=4y\)

      \((x,y)=\left(t, \frac{t^2}{4}\right)\)

    8. \((x-3)^2 = 2(y-4)\)

      \((x,y)=\left(t,4+\frac{(t-3)^2}{2}\right)\)

    9. \(y^2=12(x-3)\)

      \((x,y)=\left(3+\frac{t^2}{12},t\right)\)
